alert.note: Alert for Craig; Delaware; Mayes; Ottawa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 05 at 9:05PM CDT until September 05 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Craig County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northwestern Delaware County in northeastern Oklahoma... Southern Ottawa County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northeastern Mayes County in northeastern Oklahoma... * Until 930 PM CDT. * At 905 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles west of Afton to near Spavinaw State Park, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations in or near the path include... Miami... Vinita... Jay... Grove... Salina... Fairland... Afton... Langley... Bernice... Ketchum... Spavinaw... Wyandotte... Disney... Pensacola... Hoot Owl... Honey Creek State Park... Cherokee State Park... Bernice State Park... Cleora... Chloeta... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 283 and 307. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Damaging wind, and continuous cloud to ground lightning are occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
